text:
Not sure if it is with auto index but I have NTFS partitions mounted and apache2 just 
writes out a `0' (zero) for page output instead of some (not all) header.html files (right 
after body tag).  Sometimes it returns nothing. Works fine with apache 1.3.29 (and 
earlier), as well as with other linux utilites (like `ls' - NTFS seems to be working fine)  
 
There seems to be nothing wrong with the html files. 
No errors loged in error log about it either. 
The partitions are mounted read only. 
 
 
when I get no output in the browser other than the browser-introduced html and body 
tags (mozilla) , this is what I get in telnet: 
 
 
HTTP/1.1 200 OK 
Date: Fri, 05 Dec 2003 19:44:51 GMT 
Server: Apache/2.0.48 (Unix) 
Last-Modified: Thu, 26 Sep 2002 21:32:30 GMT 
ETag: "7652-2425-bd069780" 
Accept-Ranges: bytes 
Content-Length: 9253 
Connection: close 
Content-Type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1 
 
Connection closed by foreign host. 
 
 
Let me know I should put up some sort of working example online 
 
-Monty
creator: mebonty@monobasin.net

text:
It was already bad enough not knowing enough C to fix the bug myself and help you 
out but instead had to ``complain" (that is how I look at me submitting bug reports) but 
it was not even a bug to begin with. I feel really stupid now....sorry for wasting your time
creator: mebonty@monobasin.net
